result.execSummary:
The defendant Tiwanna R Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Business Setting <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Restitution for Firehouse Subs to be paid as a condition of probation

Costs to be paid as a condition of probation

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by agent

Follow any conditions deemed appropriate by agent

No contact with Firehouse Subs and any individual listed in the criminal complaint

Take thinking for a change course

Mental Health Evaluation and follow through with any treatment recommended

Work with and through the agent to return the property requested by the victim

timeConds.notes: Perform 25 hours of community service at agents direction

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tiwanna R Williams

Plea/sentencing hearing on October 14, 2022 at 10:30 am.

3:00 PM; Case called for Hearing.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Nesheim in court for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant Tiwanna R Williams in court.  Attorney Steven Hughes in court for Tiwanna R Williams.  Atty. Hughes provides and update, he is asking the matter be set for plea and sentencing in about 45-60 days.  No objection by the State.  Court adjourns for plea and sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Letter requesting the victim appear by zoom for the next hearing. **Reviewed by Judge Lau - Request granted**
Hearing on August 26, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

10:07 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Tiwanna R Williams in court with attorney Steven Hughes.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Jack Rieder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court also notes the victim is present via Zoom video.  Atty. Hughes provides an update, he is requesting another further proceedings in about 30 days.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.  Hearing scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
filed by victim/witness requesting the victim(s) be allowed to appear by zoom for the next hearing. **Reviewed by Judge Lau 6/20/22 - request granted, victims may appear by zoom**
Hearing on July 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant waives her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

10:29 AM Defendant Tiwanna R Williams in court with attorney Steven Hughes.  Jack A. Pitzo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Defense is ready for the prelim hearing.
ADA Pitzo states that pretrial offer is now revoked, as it was contingent on waiving the prelim.
Attorney Hughes would like a chance to speak with his client as he did not see the pretrial offer.

The Court recesses at 10:30 AM for attorney Hughes to go over the pretrial offer with the Defendant.
The Court recalls the matter at 10:39 AM with the same appearances.

The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  
Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 20, 2022 at 10:15 am.

10:11 AM Defendant Tiwanna R Williams in court with attorney Steven Hughes.  Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 10:15 am.
